name: Carmageddon
details: Argentina: Banned in the city of Buenos Aires because it depicts people being killed by motor vehicles.[4]

name: RapeLay
details: Argentina: Banned because the object of the game is to stalk and rape a woman and her two daughters, at least one of whom appears to be underage.[5][6]

name: Bully
details: Brazil: Banned for showing violence and harassment in a school setting.[10] The ban was lifted on 23 June 2016; the game can now be acquired in physical and non-physical format through Steam.[11]

name: Counter-Strike
details: Brazil: Banned because of violence and simulating a favela map in 2008. The ban was later lifted and the game is now available for sale.[12][13]

name: EverQuest
details: Brazil: Banned because of Australia's X18+ references.[12][14] The ban has been mostly lifted since 2009, except in Minas Gerais.

name: Grand Theft Auto: Episodes from Liberty City
details: Brazil: Banned in Barueri because it uses music by the Brazilian composer Hamilton da Silva Lourenço without proper permission.[15] It has been resolved and was lifted in 2012.[16]

name: Battlefield 4
details: China: Banned for discrediting China's national image as well as threatening national security. The Chinese Ministry claims that the game shows a "cultural invasion".[23]

name: Command & Conquer Generals
details: China: Banned for "smearing the image of China and the Chinese army", although the game presents China as a protagonist and glorifies the People's Liberation Army.[24]  Additionally, the China campaign has the player destroy questionable targets such as the Three Gorges Dam and the Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre in order to snuff out an invading terrorist organization.

name: Football Manager 2005
details: China: Banned for recognizing Taiwan and Tibet as independent countries. An edited version was later released globally.[25]

name: I.G.I.-2: Covert Strike
details: China: Banned because of "intentionally blackening China and the Chinese army's image".[26]

name: RapeLay
details: China: Banned because it "tends to promote and support the use of violence to compel a person to submit to sexual conduct, and the exploitation of young persons for sexual purposes".[citation needed]

name: Valkyrie Drive: Bhikkhuni
details: China: Banned because of sexual content and glorifying homosexuality.[citation needed]

name: Devotion
details: China: Banned due to an easter egg insulting Xi Jinping. The easter egg was later removed, but the game remains banned. On February 21, players discovered a fulu talisman decorating a wall in the game contained the words "Xi Jinping Winnie-the-Pooh" (Chinese: 習近平小熊維尼) in Chinese seal script, referencing a recent Chinese internet meme that compared the Chinese paramount leader and general secretary to the Disney character.

name: 10.000 Bullets
details: Germany: Banned because of high-impact gory violence.

name: 25 to Life
details: Germany: Banned because of high-impact gory violence.

details: Germany: Banned because of high-impact gory violence.

name: 50 Cent: Bulletproof
details: Germany: Banned because of high-impact gory violence.

details: Germany: Banned because of high-impact gory violence.

name: Aliens Vs. Predator
details: Germany: Banned because of high-impact gory violence.

details: Germany: Banned because of high-impact gory violence.

name: Bloodrayne
details: Germany: Banned because of high-impact gory violence. A censored version was released. The banned, uncensored version, with Nazi references removed, was available on Steam and GOG without classification until it was taken down on May 31, 2016.

name: Bloodrayne II
details: Germany: Banned because of high-impact gory violence. A censored version was released. The banned, uncensored version was available on Steam and GOG without classification until it was taken down on May 31, 2016.

name: Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare
details: Germany: Banned because of high-impact violence related to incentives and rewards via an unlockable Arcade mode.

name: Call of Duty: Black Ops
details: Germany: Banned because of high-impact gory violence.

name: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2
details: Germany: Banned because of high-impact violence related to incentives and rewards via an unlockable Arcade mode.

name: Call of Duty: World at War
details: Germany: Banned because of high-impact gory violence.

name: Carmageddon
details: Germany: Was originally released in both cut and uncut versions attaining 18+ and 16+ ratings respectively, before the uncut 18+ version was banned following the 2003 reforms. The banned uncensored version was available on Steam and GOG without classification, until it was taken down on May 31, 2016.

name: Carmageddon II: Carpocalypse Now
details: Germany: Was originally released in both cut and uncut versions attaining 18+ and 16+ ratings respectively, before the uncut 18+ version was banned following the 2003 reforms. The banned uncensored version was available on Steam and GOG without classification, until it was taken down on May 31, 2016.

name: Gal*Gun 2
details: Germany: Originally banned because of sexual activity involving people who are, or appear to be, minors. The ban was later lifted.

name: Gears of War
details: Germany: Originally banned because of high-impact gory violence. The ban was lifted in 2016.

name: Gears of War 2
details: Germany: Originally banned because of high-impact gory violence. The ban was lifted in 2016.

details: Germany: Banned because of game controls imitating brutality and exortion.

name: The Godfather 2
details: Germany: Banned because of high-impact gory violence. A censored version was released.

name: God of War
details: Germany: Originally banned because of high-impact gory violence. The ban was lifted on the basis that the characters are of Greek mythology and the gameplay put a large emphasis on puzzle-solving.

name: Golden Axe: Beast Rider
details: Germany: Banned because of high-impact gory violence.

name: Grand Theft Auto: Liberty City Stories
details: Germany: Originally banned because of high-impact gory violence. A censored version was released. The ban was lifted in 2012.

name: Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas
details: Germany: Originally banned because of high-impact gory violence. A censored version was released. The ban was lifted in 2012.

name: Grand Theft Auto: Vice City
details: Germany: Originally given a 16+ rating. However, the game was later banned because of high-impact gory violence. The game was re-censored, re-attaining the 16+ rating. The ban was lifted in 2012.

name: X-Men Origins: Wolverine (PS3, Xbox 360, PC)
details: Germany: Banned because of high-impact gory violence.

name: PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds
details: India: Banned because of extreme violence. The move comes after a direction from the Gujarat state department seeking a ban on the game, as it affects the minds of youths who tend to become violent.[47] PUBG has been banned in Ahmedabad, Rajkot, Surat, Vadodara and Bhavnagar.[48][49] The ban is lifted as of March 30, 2019.[48]

name: Valkyrie Drive: Bhikkhuni
details: Kenya: Banned because of sexual content and glorification of homosexuality. The ban does not extend to digital versions of the game.[58]

name: PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds
details: Nepal: Banned because of delinquency issues involving youths.[64] The ban does not extend to digital versions of the game.[65]

name: Criminal Girls: Invite Only
details: New Zealand: Banned because of sexual content that focuses on young persons and elements of sexual violence.[66]

name: Gal*Gun: Double Peace
details: New Zealand: Banned because "it tends to promote and support both the exploitation of children and young people, and the use of coercion to compel a person to submit to sexual conduct".[67]

name: Manhunt
details: New Zealand: Banned because of graphic violence and depictions of cruelty.[68]

name: Manhunt 2
details: New Zealand: Banned because of graphic violence and depictions of cruelty.[69]

name: Postal 2
details: New Zealand: Banned because of "Gross, abhorrent content: Urination, High Impact Violence, Animal Cruelty, Homophobia, Racial, and Ethnic Stereotypes”.[70]

name: RapeLay
details: New Zealand: Banned because it "tends to promote and support the use of violence to compel a person to submit to sexual conduct, and the exploitation of young persons for sexual purposes".[citation needed]

name: Reservoir Dogs
details: New Zealand: Banned because it "tends to promote and support the infliction of extreme violence and extreme cruelty for the purpose of entertainment".[71]

name: Three Sisters' Story
details: New Zealand: Banned because it "tends to promote and support the use of violence to compel a person to submit to sexual conduct, and the exploitation of young persons for sexual purposes".[citation needed]

name: Valkyrie Drive: Bhikkhuni
details: New Zealand: Banned because it "tends to promote and support incest between the two lead focal sisters, and the exploitation of young persons for sexual purposes".

name: Grand Theft Auto V
details: North Korea: Banned because of the presence of gambling in GTA Online. Gambling of any kind is banned in North Korea.

name: Homefront
details: North Korea: Banned because of its negative portrayal of a unified Korea under Northern rule.[72]

name: Medal of Honor: Warfighter
details: Pakistan: Banned for portraying Pakistanis negatively.[73] However, the ban does not extend to digital versions of the game.[74]

name: Postal 2
details: Pakistan: Banned because of violence against Muslims who are portrayed as terrorists. The ban does not extend to digital versions of the game.[75]

name: Valkyrie Drive: Bhikkhuni
details: Pakistan: Banned because of sexual content and glorifying homosexuality. However, the ban does not extend to digital versions of the game.[76]

name: Negligee: Love Stories
details: Pakistan: Banned for sexual content and glorifying homosexuality.[citation needed] The ban does not extend to digital versions of the game.[77]

name: God of War (franchise)
details: Suadia Arabia: Banned for a few weeks due to the presence of interactive sex scenes, partial nudity and sexual themes, as well as the word "God" in the title. In 2018, the newest game in the series was approved for release.[citation needed]

name: Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare
details: Suadia Arabia: Banned for a few weeks because of role-playing the Middle East as terrorists.[citation needed]

name: Assassin's Creed
details: Suadia Arabia: Banned for two weeks because of a perceived negative portrayal of Arabs. Later completely banned due to its use in the Blue Whale Challenge.[citation needed]

name: Grand Theft Auto (series)
details: Suadia Arabia: Banned for extreme impact violence and nudity.[citation needed]

name: Heavy Rain
details: Suadia Arabia: Banned because of high impact violence, nudity and a sex scene.[citation needed]

name: L.A. Noire
details: Suadia Arabia: Banned because of extreme impact violence and nudity.[citation needed]

name: Postal 2
details: Suadia Arabia: Banned because of extreme impact violence, nudity and the portrayal of Muslims as terrorists.

name: Red Dead Redemption
details: Suadia Arabia: Banned due to nudity, prostitution, violence and cruelty.[citation needed]

name: Red Dead Redemption 2
details: Suadia Arabia: Banned due to nudity, prostitution, violence and cruelty.

name: Manhunt (video game series)
details: Suadia Arabia: Banned because of low impact scary violence and cruelty.[citation needed]

name: Manhunt 2
details: Suadia Arabia: Banned for "gross, unrelenting, and gratuitous violence".[citation needed]

name: South Park: The Stick of Truth/The Fractured but Whole
details: Suadia Arabia: Banned because of extremely offensive content.[citation needed]

name: Valkyrie Drive: Bhikkhuni
details: Suadia Arabia: Banned due to sexual content and excessive themes of glorifying homosexuality.[citation needed]

name: Wolfenstein
details: Suadia Arabia: Banned because of the presence of interactive sex scenes.[citation needed]

name: Metro (series)
details: Suadia Arabia: Banned due to its use in the Blue Whale Challenge.[citation needed]

name: Half-Life
details: Singapore: Banned because of violence.[86]  The ban was met with uproar as the local gaming community and retailers scrambled to start petitions to save the game. The government decided to lift the ban after a week, as the game had been released for more than a year and the ban would impact the local LAN gaming and retail market.[87]

name: Mass Effect
details: Singapore: Banned because of a homosexual encounter between a feminine alien and female human.[88] The ban was later lifted and the title re-rated M18.[89]

name: The Darkness
details: Singapore: Banned because of excessive violence.[90] The ban was later lifted and the title re-rated M18.[citation needed]

name: Mortal Kombat
details: South Korea: Banned because of excessive violence and cruelty.[72]

name: Homefront
details: South Korea: Banned because of its negative portrayal of a unified Korea under Northern rule.[72]

name: Danganronpa V3
details: South Korea: The September 2017 release was cancelled because of a case in South Korea where a 17-year-old girl killed and dismembered an 8-year-old child.[citation needed] The game was banned to prevent controversies.[citation needed]

name: BlazBlue: Continuum Shift
details: UAE: Banned likely due to suggestive and revealing outfits on some characters.[97] However, the ban did not extend to digital versions of the game.

name: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2
details: UAE: This game was banned after players in the GCC noticed that the picture frames in some maps had quotations from the Qur'an, which were very offensive to Muslims.[citation needed] The ban was lifted after the developers removed the text on the frames.

name: Darksiders
details: UAE: Banned likely due to contradicting with customs and traditions.[98] However, the ban did not extend to the digital version of the game. Its sequel, Darksiders II, which features similar themes, was released without issues, and even had a localised print release for the PlayStation 3 version.

name: Dead IslandDead Island: Riptide
details: UAE: Both banned likely due to "extreme depictions of violence and scantily-clad game characters".[99] However, the ban did not extend to digital versions of the games.

name: Dead Rising 2
details: UAE: Banned likely due to violence, gambling, and nudity.[100] The ban has since been lifted for newer prints of the game.

name: Dragon Age: Origins
details: UAE: Banned likely due to sexual themes, including possible homosexual relationships.[101] The ban has since been lifted for the digital versions of the game.

name: Fallout: New Vegas
details: UAE: Banned likely due to gambling and sexual themes.[102] However, the ban did not extend to the digital version of the game.

name: Gal*Gun: Double PeaceGal*Gun 2
details: UAE: Both banned likely due to sexual themes. However, the ban did not extend to the digital versions of the games.[103][104]

name: The Godfather II
details: UAE: Banned likely due to nudity.[105]

name: God of War
details: UAE: The first title in the series was banned after complaints were filed regarding religious and sexual content in the game, and subsequently, the next seven games in the series were banned for similar reasons. The 2018 title God of War was the first entry to be legally approved for release in the U.A.E.[106]

name: Grand Theft Auto
details: UAE: Banned likely due to violence, cruelty and sexual content. For unknown reasons, Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas has been available via Steam ever since the PC version of Grand Theft Auto V was launched, which itself is openly available on Steam from the debut. Shortly after Steam introduced the dirham as the official currency for U.A.E. user accounts on November 10, 2015,[107] the majority of Rockstar's games became available for purchase for those user accounts, including most Grand Theft Auto titles (For unknown reasons, almost all of Rockstar's games were regionally locked out on Steam, whether banned or not.).

name: Heavy Rain
details: UAE: Banned likely due to graphic violence, sexual content, nudity[108] and a sultry seduction scene.[109]

name: Injustice: Gods Among Us
details: UAE: Despite being initially marketed for Middle Eastern distribution under the title of Injustice: The Mighty Among Us, the game failed to surpass the NMC's censors for a period of time,[110] and was banned likely due to the case package and on-disc software title itself being identical to its European release, with the term "God" retained (the official reason was not given). The game had been demonstrated at various events in the U.A.E. without incident for many months before the official release date. However, the ban on the title has since been lifted.[110] The expanded Ultimate Edition was released on schedule and distributed regularly.

name: Mafia II
details: UAE: Banned likely due to excessive violence and nudity.[111] The ban has since been lifted for digital versions of the game.

name: Mass Effect 2Mass Effect 3
details: UAE: Both banned likely due to possible homosexual relationships.[101] However, the ban did not extend to the digital versions of the games.

name: Max Payne 3
details: UAE: Banned likely due to excessive violence and sexual themes.[112] The ban was issued roughly three weeks after the official release. The ban has since been lifted for digital versions of the game.[113]

name: Omega Labyrinth Z
details: UAE: Banned likely due to excessive sexual themes. However, the ban did not extend to the digital version of the game.[citation needed]

name: Postal 2
details: UAE: Banned likely due to violence against Muslims, as well as excessive violence, sexual themes and other highly questionable content. However, the ban did not extend to the digital version of the game.

name: Red Dead Redemption
details: UAE: Was initially banned,[114] likely due to nudity. The ban was lifted two months after the official release date.[115][116]

name: ROBLOX
details: UAE: Banned due to the game containing swearing and sexually explicit material.[117][118]

name: Saints Row: The ThirdSaints Row IV
details: UAE: Both banned likely due to sexual themes, excessive violence, and use of drugs and alcohol.[119] However, the ban did not extend to the digital versions of the games.

name: Spec Ops: The Line
details: UAE: Banned likely due to the game's fictional depiction of the UAE's real-life city of Dubai in a state of ravage and destruction. Unlike other banned video games, the NMC had extended their focus for this title going far as to issue the TRA to block the game's official website[120] and subsequently prevent the title from being distributed throughout the rest of the GCC, as well as Jordan, and Lebanon.[121] Even local retailers, such as Geekay Games, are unable to sell the game via their online shops to UAE residents.[122] The game remains unavailable via digital platforms such as Steam and PSN.

name: Valkyrie Drive: Bhikkhuni
details: UAE: Banned likely due to homosexual relationships between characters and high-impact sexual themes. However, the ban did not extend to the digital version of the game.[123]

name: Watch Dogs
details: UAE: Was initially banned likely due to sexual themes, nudity, excessive depictions of violence, and use of drugs and alcohol. The game's local distributor had confirmed that the title will be available in the U.A.E. and the rest of the region by August 15, 2014 for some platforms (PS3, PS4, Xbox 360) and without any in-game alterations.[124] Only copies of the game with localised Middle East covers were allowed, subsequently banning imported copies for other platforms. For example, the Xbox One version was not released until some time after the console itself was officially launched in September 2014. The PC version remains unavailable, consequently blocking access to the downloadable version on Steam. Due to the fact Ubisoft cannot officially distribute their games on Nintendo consoles specifically for the Middle East (for various reasons), the Wii U version remains unavailable (Ubisoft games on Nintendo consoles are generally available as imported products in the region).

name: Carmageddon
details: United Kingdom: Was threatened with being refused certification in its uncut form. Was subsequently altered to replace pedestrians with zombies.[127] The restriction was later lifted, and a patch was released to restore the original human content.

name: Manhunt 2
details: United Kingdom: The uncut version was the only game to be refused classification by the BBFC (therefore banned), due to excessive graphic violence and cruelty.[128] After this, a modified version was made and submitted for certification – this was initially refused classification as well, but was allowed to be sold after an appeal (despite a successful challenge to this ruling).

name: Omega Labyrinth Z
details: United Kingdom: Banned anywhere outside of Japan for featuring sexually explicit material involving underage characters.[citation needed]

name: RapeLay
details: United Kingdom: Banned because it "tends to promote and support the use of violence to compel a person to submit to sexual conduct, and the exploitation of young persons for sexual purposes".[citation needed]

name: The Punisher
details: United Kingdom: Despite the game already being the edited American release, it was threatened with being refused classification due to objectionable content: The interrogation scenes were deemed graphically controversial and could cause harm to the public. The publishers made edits at the request of the BBFC to further mask these scenes,[129] and this final version received an 18 certificate.
